poem:
The Unscripted Premiere

A marquee darkens, letters unscrewed,
film unseen, yet characters dissolved,
the AI breath held back—
a backlash of shadows.

London whispers, tea on pause,
what if the algorithms knew too much?
The projector sits unused, 
the script in its silent cradle.

Art, on this corner, ambitious yet cautious.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "London premiere of movie with AI-generated script cancelled after backlash A cinema in London has cancelled the world premiere of a film with a script generated by AI after a backlash. The Prince Charles cinema, located in London’s West End and which traditionally screens cult and art films, was due to host a showing of a new production called The Last Screenwriter on Sunday. However the cinema announced on social media that the screening would". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
